bio: Chef Liu: Master of Szechuan cuisine, with a love for bold flavors and spicy dishes. Famous for his ma po tofu, he brings fiery heat to every dish he creates.he is our main chef
instructions: Cut the tofu into small cubes and set aside.
Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add the Sichuan peppercorns and stir-fry for a few seconds until fragrant.
Add the ground pork and stir-fry until browned and cooked through.
Add the doubanjiang, garlic, scallions, and ginger, and stir-fry for a few minutes until fragrant.
Add the chicken stock and bring to a simmer.
Add the tofu cubes and gently stir to coat.
In a small bowl, mix together the cornstarch and a little water to make a slurry.
Add the cornstarch slurry to the wok and stir gently until the sauce thickens.
Add salt to taste.
